text: It is obvious that the President is a pathological liar who does not understand the Constitution. The fact is that if Mr. Trump continues to disregard the right of Congress to subpoena, he will leave House Members with no choice but to begin an impeachment inquiry.

If Amazon can raise its minimum wage to $15 an hour, there is no reason that McDonald’s—a company that took in $1.4 billion in profit and paid its CEO $22 million—can’t also pay its workers a living wage.

Massive corporations are profiting to the tune of billions of dollars and are still not providing livable wages for workers. Proud to stand with #FightFor15 today to demand $15 minimum wage, union support and fair treatment for workers and their families. https://twitter.com/fightfor15/status/1131622572204838912 QT @fightfor15 #FightFor15 workers across the country walked off the job ON STRIKE today. We're demanding $15 an hour, and union rights. 

Now, we're hitting up @McDonalds stores across our local cities to hand out these fliers to customers about why. You can join us!

The right to vote is fundamental to participation in our society. This bill will remove barriers to reintegration and restore voting rights for thousands of Nevadans. I commend Speaker @JasonFrierson and the Nevada Legislature for passing this legislation. https://twitter.com/MarshallProj/status/1131620316004921346 QT @MarshallProj This week, Nevada lawmakers voted to restore voting rights to people with felony convictions after their release. If the governor signs the bill, it will go into effect July 1 and will also apply to those who already have been released.

via @reviewjournal https://www.reviewjournal.com/news/politics-and-government/2019-legislature/legislature-moves-to-restore-felons-voting-rights-after-release-1670435/
